intro: Galium adriaticum, commonly known as Adriatic bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in early summer. Its fruit is a small, two-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Galium adriaticum thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
